remarks: Lemma for ~ prmrec .  There are at most ` 2 ^ K ` squarefree numbers which divide no primes larger than ` K ` .  (We could strengthen this to ` 2 ^ # ( Prime i^i ( 1 ... K ) ) ` but there's no reason to.)  We establish the inequality by showing that the prime counts of the number up to ` K ` completely determine it because all higher prime counts are zero, and they are all at most ` 1 ` because no square divides the number, so there are at most ` 2 ^ K ` possibilities.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Aug-2014.)
